page.title: 19Daresbury school
page.content: The school was founded by Richard Ryder. He said that he would pay a wage of Â£10 to any schoolmaster who was willing. The school opened as a boys school. They were taught virtually no arithmetic and did not have any textbooks so most work was done by heart. Writing was done on slates which could be wiped clean and reused. A number of parishes joined and by 1874 the school had grown to take 110 boys and girls and 95 infants. The first headmaster appointed was Mr.John Cooper in 1875 and the school was enlarged in 1877. It was an all age school until 1944 when it became a primary school. Today there are 70 children attending. The main building consists of five rooms. There are outside toilets and lunches are brought from Knutsford each day. There are football and netball teams.
